meanings.definition: Relating to or affecting the lungs
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the patient had a pneumonic infection in his lungs.
meanings.sent2: The pneumonic illness made it hard for him to breathe.
meanings.sent3: The pneumonic condition in his lungs was like a stubborn guest overstaying its welcome.
meanings.sent4: The smoke-filled room was a pneumonic reminder of the polluted air outside.
meanings.sent5: The pneumonic cough echoed through the quiet hospital ward.

meanings.definition: A device used to assist with breathing
meanings.sent1: The nurse handed the patient a pneumonic to help him breathe better.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended using a pneumonic to aid in his recovery.
meanings.sent3: The little girl thought the pneumonic looked like a tiny robot for her lungs.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic sound of the pneumonic soothed him to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The portable pneumonic was a lifesaver during the hiking trip.

meanings.definition: A memory aid or mnemonic device
meanings.sent1: She used a pneumonic to remember the order of the planets.
meanings.sent2: The students created pneumonics to help them study for the test.
meanings.sent3: The silly pneumonic made her giggle every time she recalled it.
